text: Avi Wigderson (; born 9 September 1956) is an Israeli-American mathematician and computer scientist. He is the Herbert H. Maass Professor in the school of mathematics at the Institute for Advanced Study in Princeton, New Jersey. He won the Abel Prize in 2021 and Turing Award in 2023 for his work. ==References== Category:1956 births Category:Living people Category:Abel Prize winners Category:American computer scientists Category:Israeli mathematicians Category:Academics from New Jersey Category:People from Haifa Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:American mathematicians Category:Princeton University faculty
title: Avi Wigderson
